required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing Online Interventions for Men's' Mental Health and Wellbeing
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing Online Interventions for Men's' Mental Health and Wellbeing

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test a comprehensive, male-oriented, online screening and referral (Screening for Mental Health; SMH) and male-oriented online information and referral intervention program (Man Therapy; MT) to improve mental health and wellbeing with a focus on prevention of suicide and help-seeking behaviors among middle-aged men. The online programs will be offered together to maximize the effect on reducing suicide behavior and increasing mental health help-seeking behaviors for men. If successful in decreasing suicide behavior and ideation and increasing suicide help-seeking behavior, this intervention could be scaled up to contribute to a reduction in suicide behaviors and deaths across the country.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in depression symptoms as measured by The HANDS: Harvard Department of Psychiatry National Depression Screening Day Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; 2 weeks post randomization; 12 weeks post randomization

primary_outcome.measure: Change in suicide risk as measured by the Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Scale-Screen Version
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; 2 weeks post randomization; 12 weeks post randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: change in attitudes toward help-seeking behavior as measured by the Attitudes Toward Seeking Professional Help short-form
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks post randomization; 12 weeks post randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: change in alcohol use/abuse as measured by the Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks post randomization; 12 weeks post randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: change in relationship conflicts as measured by the Psychological Aggression Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks post randomization; 12 weeks post randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: change in financial situation as measured by two items (J1 and J4) of the 2009 National Financial Capability Study, Financial Industry Regulatory Authority
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks post randomization; 12 weeks post randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: change in social support as measured by the Perceived Social Support and/or Conflict scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks post randomization; 12 weeks post randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: change in interpersonal needs as measured by the Interpersonal Needs Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks post randomization; 12 weeks post randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: change in drug use/abuse as measured by the National Institute of Drug Abuse Quick Screen
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks post randomization; 12 weeks post randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: change in physical aggression as measured by the Physical Aggression Index scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks post randomization; 12 weeks post randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: change in help seeking behavior as measured by the Perceived Stigma and Barriers to Care for Psychological Problems scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks post randomization; 12 weeks post randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: change in help seeking behavior as measured by the General Help Seeking Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks post randomization; 12 weeks post randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: change in physical and mental health as measured by the Healthy Days Measures
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks post randomization; 12 weeks post randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: change in anger as measures by the DSM-5 Self Rated Level 1 Cross-Cutting Symptom Measure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; 2 weeks post randomization; 12 weeks post randomization

arm_group.description: Participants in the Screening for Mental Health only (control) group will complete the online depression and suicide screening and receive immediate feedback and referrals.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Screening for Mental Health & Man Therapy
arm_group.description: Participants assigned to Screening for Mental Health & Man Therapy (intervention) group will be offered the Man Therapy program in conjunction with Screening for Mental Health.

intervention.description: Participants in the Screening for Mental Health (SMH)-only group will complete the online depression and suicide screening and receive immediate feedback and referrals.

intervention.intervention_name: Screening for Mental Health & Man Therapy
intervention.description: Participants assigned to Screening for Mental Health, plus Man Therapy (SMH+MT) group will be offered the Man Therapy program in conjunction with Screening for Mental Health. MT provides online early intervention services designed specifically for men who are at risk for suicide and are less likely to engage in help-seeking behavior. MT takes an innovative and humorous approach to mental health education and help seeking through a fictional "therapist" named Dr. Rich Mahogany, who is a no-nonsense "man's man" who informs men about the importance of honest talk about life's challenges in addressing their problems. The web portal allows review "manly mental health information, facts and tips," explore "man therapies," and view videos of men with lived experience.
intervention.arm_group_label: Screening for Mental Health & Man Therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. men living in Michigan;
2. 25-64 years of age at time of enrollment;
3. scoring in the moderate- to high-risk range (or answering positively on Question 9) on the Harvard Department of Psychiatry/NDSD Scale (HANDS), scoring in the moderate- to high-risk range for anger on the DSM-5 Level 1 Cross-Cutting Symptom Measure, or identifying any risk for suicide ideation or behavior on the Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Sale (C-SSRS); and
4. fluent in reading English
Exclusion Criteria:
1. females
2. scoring in the low risk range on the Harvard Department of Psychiatry/NDSD Scale (HANDS), scoring in the low risk range for anger on the DSM-5 Level 1 Cross-Cutting Symptom Measure, or not identifying any risk for suicide ideation or behavior on the Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Sale (C-SSRS); and
3. not fluent in reading English
